Job Highlight

5 years’ experience in environmental compliance
Familiar with ISO9001/ISO45001/ISO14001/ISO14064 GHG Emission

Job Responsibilities:

Develop and implement the Group’s environmental compliance; strategies and plan to achieve our sustainability goals.
To build and drive environmental compliance mindset of employees’ behavior to achieve green environment in factories.
Set up road map and lead the environmental protection team on sustainability of green manufacturing.
Deploy and implement the environmental policies and guidelines, set up KPI indicators and control mechanism in line with international standards and statutory requirements.
Provide guidance to the environmental management of factories and organize regular meetings in reviewing the progress of compliance.
Monitor environmental safety implementation issues, oversee improvement progress on corrective action plans and communicate with relevant internal / external parties for the results achieved. Organize regular meetings about environmental matters.
Track and evaluate wastes discharge mechanism effectiveness, identify alternatives to drive reduction of discharge of chemical waste and GHG, to eliminate any potential environmental hazards and pollution.
Lead and Facilitate factories on 3rd party certification on relevant accreditation of environmental compliance scheme in accordance with statutory requirements / regulations and international standards.
Prevent, reduce or eliminate hazards that may affect the health of employees.
Set up crisis management policies and procedures, and site crisis management team to analyze and mitigate risks and strengthen the capability of all sites to deal with crisis.
Organize social and environmental engagement events both within and outside the group.
Prepare the group Environmental report required by the listing rule of the Hong Kong stock Exchange.

Requirements:

University degree or above in environment.
At least 5 years’ experience in environmental compliance and health and safety work experience in sizable manufacturing enterprises.
Familiar with the statutory requirements and international on safety and environmental protection as well as related measurement and production processes.
Familiar with standards and audit requirements of ISO9001/ISO45001/ISO14001/ISO14064 or other related systems.
Strong leadership and management skills required.
Sound project management, analytical and problem solving skills.
Proactive and tactful in communication.
Proficiency in computer software, and in both spoken and written English and Chinese, including Mandarin.
Frequent travel to support overseas operation is required.
Candidate with more experience will be considered as Environmental Protection Manager

Reporting to Principal Environmental Consultant, you will be responsible for planning, developing and managing net zero carbon related works.

Your Next Challenge

Support the Sustainability Team and the wider business to establish and shape the development and success of our Net Zero Advisory business by contributing to the strategy, implementation plans and build out of key activities.
Identify target and emerging clients, and creating winning proposals to seed new business opportunities
Contribute to growing our business with respect to Net Zero advisory services, ultimately becoming a ‘trusted advisor’ to our existing and future client base
Identify and realise opportunities for application of Mott MacDonald’s Moata Carbon Portal, and the deployment of other digital tools and services to assist clients in reducing their carbon footprint
Contribute to the creation of Net Zero advisory marketing and communication initiatives, campaigns and products, including thought leadership and events
Support in building internal alignment, engagement and support for the Net Zero Initiative and acting as the local interface in coordinating with the region Net Zero Advisors, sharing knowledge, learnings and success, and leveraging experience across the Group
Conduct benchmarking and advising clients on strategy, targets, priorities, pathways, road mapping and solutions associated with Net Zero objectives
Driving high levels of technical quality delivery of Net Zero advisory services, ensuring the production of deliverables to agreed timelines and within budget

What You'll Need

 Bachelor Degree in Environmental Engineering, Building Services or related discipline
 At least 7 years’ experience working in corporate sustainability and environment roles
 Knowledge of key methodologies associated with energy and carbon reduction in the built environment, e.g. carbon foot printing, energy assessments, life cycle assessment, carbon management and broader sustainability such as the PAS2080, the UN SDGs, etc.
 Policy development and/or research experience in low and net zero carbon themes
 Experience in client engagement with an ability to establish strong client relationships
 An attitude and desire to help clients on their decarbonisation journey and progress towards Net Zero
 Bring a range of report writing, and visual and verbal presentation techniques
 Have a keen interest and enthusiasm for sustainability in buildings and infrastructure.
 Be a versatile, quick thinker and show willingness and ability to pick up new concepts quickly.
 Have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
 Agile and collaborative, leveraging expertise from others when needed.
 Enjoy a client-facing role with proven track record in managing projects and clients.

We offer competitive remuneration package including 13th month salary, MPF plan and group medical insurance for dependents.

description:
Job duty

To assist in conducting scientific research and studies on museum collection, heritage and conservation materials, preservation and conservation methodologies, environment in museums and collection store
To assist in conducting research for exhibitions and condition checking on the exhibits in the exhibition halls and/or in collection store
To provide research and conservation services as required and prepare the associated report
To assist with the organization of educational and extension preogrames
To perform any other duties as assigned by the supervisors

Job requirement

A bachelor's degree from a University in Hong Kong, or equivalent, majoring in one of the following subjects: Conservation, Applied Chemistry/Chemistry, Materials Science, Materials Engineering, or equivalent;
Possess a good command of both Chinese and English and have met the language proficiency requirements of "Level 2" result in Use of English and "Level l" result in Use of Chinese in the CRE or equivalent results (refers to Note 1 and 2); fluency in Putonghua is an advantage
Possess good knowledge in computer applications, including MS word, excel, powerpoint and Chinese word processing
Have at least 12 months of full time work experience, with proven experience in conducting scientific research 
Work experience in the field of art/cultural heritage conservation and operating analytical equipment is preferred.

Note 1:
Grade C or above in Use of English of the Hong  Kong  Advanced  Level Examination (HKALE), or equivalent, are accepted as equivalent to Level 2 result in the UE paper of the CRE. Grade D or above in Chinese Language and Culture or Chinese Language and Litera1ure of the HKALE are accepted as equivalent to Level 1 result in the UC paper of the CRE.

Level 5 or above in English Language of the Hong Kong Diploma of Secondary Education Examination (HKDSEE) is accepted as equivalent to Level 2 in the UE paper of the CRE. Level 4 or above in Chinese Language of the HKDS EE is accepted as equivalent to Level 1 in the UC paper of the CRE.

Note 2: 
An overall band of 6.5 or above with no subtest score below band 6  obtained in the same sitting in the Academic Module of the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) within the two-year validity period of the test result are considered as having met the English language proficiency requirement of the post.)
